Description: 4 fragments of papyrus, possibly stuck together for bookbinding purposes. Fragments 1-3 are in Greek, written in different cursive hands (fragment 1 is written along the papyrus fibres, 2 and 3 against). Fragment 4 is 4 lines of Coptic and 1 of Greek preserving part of an order for payment of woollen garments, written against the fibres. Mounted with EA 75308.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (118093) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/118093)
Clackson 2008 / It is our father who writes: orders from the monastery of Apollo at Bawit
